Judul: EXPLORATION ECONOMICS OF PRIMARY GOLD WITH  SPECIAL REFERENCE TO INDONESIA
Abstrak: Abstrak:   Financing exploration for primary gold has always been a problem in the past, present, and at   least in the near future. This is mainly due the non-continuity of the deposit, the low level gold to be detected   in the samples (ppb range), the very low success ratio (0.5% - 4%) and the fluctuating price of gold. Gold   prices become a barometer for exploration after the "Bretton-Wood" was abolished in 1971.
